thread.title: Press release: Elliott to unveil Sprint Cup paint scheme on Race Hub
thread.title_full: Press release: Elliott to unveil Sprint Cup paint scheme on Race Hub

title: Press release: Elliott to unveil Sprint Cup paint scheme on Race Hub
text:
Updated Oct 16, 2015 at 10:30a ET 
Hendrick Motorsports driver Chase Elliott , who makes the jump to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series next season, will unveil his 2016 No. 24 NAPA Auto Parts Chevrolet SS paint scheme on NASCAR Race Hub on FS1 this coming Monday at 6 p.m. ET. 
The anticipated reveal is being simulcast in New York City's Times Square on the giant FOX video screen. 
Elliott, 19, the defending NASCAR XFINITY Series champion and NASCAR's youngest-ever national series champion, will pull the cover off the car he pilots in 24 Sprint Cup races next season, including the Feb. 21 Daytona 500, which will be televised live on FOX. The season-opening race will kick off NAPA Auto Parts' primary sponsorship of the rookie-of-the-year contender. 
Elliott, who sits down with co-hosts Adam Alexander and Danielle Trotta on the "Hub," competed in five points-paying Sprint Cup events this season, in addition to the Sprint Showdown, in preparation for his first full series campaign with Hendrick Motorsports.
